Sentence: Ned's son Bran then discovers Cersei Lannister and her (wife) brother Jaime Lannister having sex, and Jaime pushes Bran from a window to silence him (Jaime)
Tyrion Lannister, a little person who is brother to Cersei and Jaime, travels with Jon to the Wall to see the massive structure

In King's Landing, Ned has figured out why the Hand was killed: he (Ned) had discovered that Joffrey was not really Robert's child but was actually the product of Cersei's sexual relationship with her (knight) brother, Jaime
Ned does not tell Robert that he (Ned) knows Joffrey is not the true heir, since he (Ned) is the son of Cersei and Jaime
Tywin Lannister, father to Tyrion, Cersei, and Jaime, wages war with Catelyn and her (King) son, Robb Stark
